Enable P2P from action bar button above or system settings

This app is used to manage a playlist cooperatively.
 Wi-Fi Direct (P2P) is used to connect Android devices together.

 The person being connected to is the playlist/group owner.
 The owner explicitly controls the playlist.
 Peers connected to the owner can add songs to the playlist queue or vote to skip the current song (majority required).

 As a shortcut, several actions can be performed by swiping:
 swipe top - display playlist
 swipe bottom - discover nearby devices
 swipe right - add song to playlist
 swipe left - vote to skip
